tool.name: Scaling
tool.help:
This tool scales the data. This referes to multiplying each column (variable) of the data table by a number. It is often useful to scale the data before multivariate analysis as the scale of variables will influence the results such that variables with larger values will contribute more "weight" than variables with smaller values.
**Methods**
Auto scaling mean-centers and divides each column by its standard deviation.
Pareto scaling mean-centers and divides each column by the square root of its standard deviation.
Range scaling mean-centers and divides each column by it range.
Mean-centering subtracts the column (variable) mean from each value in the corresponding column.
'''TIP''' Auto scaling is a standard way to scale data. Pareto scaling is useful when some variables contain noise (e.g. NMR spectra binned incrementally) and helps to reduce the influence from the low-valued noisy bins by leaving them relatively lower in scale.
